pullRequest.body:
Prove that each elementary row operation is equivalent to a multiplication by an elementary matrix, has another row operation which inverts it, and that each elementary matrix has a left inverse. 

This is a very large PR and I understand it will take time. This is my first one and will likely have issues but I will be ready to answer questions/fix them as soon as possible.

Co-authored-by: Christopher Lynch <clynch@clarkson.edu>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [ae67d90d92](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21018/commits/ae67d90d92ae8fc9b3f1b7aeb308a70145a60711)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Matrix.ElementaryRowOperations` (new file)|904|
| `Mathlib.Data.Matrix.GaussianElimination` (new file)|905|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ addMulRowElemMat`
`+ addMulRowElemMat_eq_addMulRow`
`+ addMulRowMat_eq_addMulRow`
`+ addMulRowToZero`
`+ addMulRow_addMulRow_neg_cancel_left`
`+ addMulRow_elem_inv`
`+ addMulRow_eq_add_mul_row`
`+ addMulRow_neg_cancel`
`+ addMulRow_other_rows_same`
`+ addMulRowi`
`+ addMulRownoti`
`+ gauss`
`+ gaussForward`
`+ gaussForwardPivot`
`+ lessSucc`
`+ maxColVal_RowPos_Max2`
`+ maxMatCol`
`+ maxMatColEither`
`+ maxMatColGreaterLeft`
`+ maxMatColGreaterRight`
`+ morePrev`
`+ mulRowElemMat`
`+ mulRowElemMat_eq_mulRow`
`+ mulRowMat_eq_mulRow`
`+ mulRow_elem_inv`
`+ mulRow_eq_mul_row`
`+ mulRow_inv_cancel`
`+ mulRow_mulRow_inv_cancel_left`
`+ mulRow_other_rows_same`
`+ mulRowi`
`+ mulRownoti`
`+ mulRowtoOne`
`+ swapRowElemMat`
`+ swapRowElemMat_eq_swapRow`
`+ swapRow_comm`
`+ swapRow_elem_inv`
`+ swapRow_eq_first`
`+ swapRow_eq_second`
`+ swapRow_involutive`
`+ swapRow_other_rows_same`
`+ turnAboveIntoZero`
`+ turnAboveIntoZeroProof`
`+ turnBelowIntoZero`
`+ turnBelowIntoZeroProof`
`++ addMulRow`
`++ dupRow`
`++ maxColVal_RowPos`
`++ mulRow`
`++ swapRow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I wonder whether it might be better to define:
```lean
inductive Elementary (n  : Type*) [Monoid ] : Type*
  | swap (i j : n) : Elementary n 
  | mul (i : n) (a : ) : Elementary n 
  | add_mul (i j : n) (h : i  j) (a : ) : Elementary n 
```
One could then define a function `Elementary.toGeneralLinearGroup` to get an invertible matrix. out of it. Then all the case splitting can happen within the inductive type. This idea is not fully fleshed out, it was just my immediate reaction upon seeing this PR.
Thanks! I think this morally has some overlap with the existing `Matrix.transvection`, so I think @sgouezel should probably take a look too.

I wonder whether it might be better to define:
```lean
inductive Elementary (n  : Type*) [Monoid ] : Type*
  | swap (i j : n) : Elementary n 
  | mul (i : n) (a : ) : Elementary n 
  | add_mul (i j : n) (h : i  j) (a : ) : Elementary n 
```
One could then define a function `Elementary.toGeneralLinearGroup` to get an invertible matrix. out of it. Then all the case splitting can happen within the inductive type. This idea is not fully fleshed out, it was just my immediate reaction upon seeing this PR.
This is probably a little nicer defined as `M.submatrix (Equiv.swap i j) id`
And of course, this overlaps with #19812

Thank you so much for all of the feedback so far! I took a look and I see how there is some overlap, how should I tackle that? Also, in terms of using `M.submatrix *Equiv.swap i j) id`, is it better to use it because it will simplify other proofs? I tried it and I would have to change many of the subsequent proofs so I'm wondering if that's necessary. Thank you again for all of the help so far.

```suggestion
def swapRowElemMat [One ] [Zero ] (i : m) (j : m) : Matrix m m  :=
```
is the naming convention, same for the other `elem_mat` `def`s.
Please remove these files from the PR.

typo:
```suggestion
- `swapRow`: A row is swapped with another row.
```

```suggestion
theorem swapRow_involutive (i : m) (j : m) :
    Function.Involutive (swapRow  i j) := by
```
which should be the same proof modulo an `intro M`.
I'm sorry, could you explain exactly what you mean by `intro M`? I'm not sure what that would look like and I am partially wondering why solve it like that instead.

I meant that if you make the  change I suggest, the same proof should work once you add an `intro` tactic at the start.

But I think it is now best to wait for #19812

Okay I will try that out, thank you!

Also, in terms of #19812, what is the way to move forward on this? The file worked on is in a very different location (mine is under Data), and some of the work overlaps but he has some further theorems on `swapRow` and I have `mulRow` and `addMulRow` theorems, so I am trying to figure out how a conflict like this is solved. I also have work done directly for Gaussian Elimination and am working on making a PR for that. What's the protocol for this? Should I reach out to the contributor? Thank you again for the help.

> I meant that if you make the change I suggest, the same proof should work once you add an `intro` tactic at the start.
> 
> But I think it is now best to wait for #19812

Hi @eric-wieser, just wanted to follow-up to check what the best course of action is. Thank you so much for all of the help so far!

In such a case, just directly contact the PR author, in this case me :) Sorry for letting you wait, the PR was not high up on my priority list and I had not seen this discussion. I'll update the PR ASAP so that you hopefully are unblocked soon.

Thanks for the clarification and update :) I'll be sure to keep that in mind next time, I'm sorry for not contacting you earlier! Whenever you're done (no rush), please let me know how you think we should move forward and if I should make any adjustments based on your PR.
Hey @chrisflav, I hope you are doing well! I was just wondering if you had updated the PR and if you could provide any guidance of how I should move forward, I'm sorry to bother again.

The PR #19812 is merged, so you should merge master into your branch and then replace your swap matrices by [Matrix.swap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/Swap.html#Matrix.swap).
Thank you for clarifying!

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Matrix): add file with key definitions and theorems about elementary row operations
